nodes.comment: We have freedom of choice and most are already wearing the masks.

nodes.comment: I believe in freedom and choice!

nodes.comment: I'm proud of living in a city that believes in freedom and breathing fresh air.

nodes.extracted: I'm proud of living in a city that believes in freedom and breathing fresh air.

nodes.comment: Freedom, without it you have nothing.
nodes.author: Stephanie Cain
nodes.extracted: Freedom, without it you have nothing.

nodes.comment: Not only are masks unnecessary they’re ineffective. The broader lesson for our children is the lesson of individual Liberty. There’s enough tyrannical ideology being distributed within our schools, our children our future need to learn what individualism and freedom means. You can wear a mask or not. You can’t force your view on another. If you’re scared of non mask wearers you stay home. Those afraid stay home not those who are not afraid to be out in the world.
nodes.author: James Downey
nodes.extracted: There’s enough tyrannical ideology being distributed within our schools, our children our future need to learn what individualism and freedom means.

nodes.comment: My employer is trying to force this and it’s so unfair, we have to support freedom of choice and informed consent.
nodes.author: Jayme Howe
nodes.extracted: My employer is trying to force this and it’s so unfair, we have to support freedom of choice and informed consent.

nodes.comment: Please sign this petition to give freedom of choice and fresh air to our children.
nodes.author: Laura Haak
nodes.extracted: Please sign this petition to give freedom of choice and fresh air to our children.

nodes.comment: We should have the freedom to make decisions that regard our personal health and our medical freedom. Kids should not be forced to wear anything they or their parents are not comfortable with!
nodes.author: jacqueline brown
nodes.extracted: We should have the freedom to make decisions that regard our personal health and our medical freedom.

nodes.comment: Freedom of choice we as parents have the right to choose and so do our children wearing masks makes it difficult to breathe for our children and hinders there ability to concentrate

nodes.extracted: Freedom of choice we as parents have the right to choose and so do our children wearing masks makes it difficult to breathe for our children and hinders there ability to concentrate

nodes.comment: I’m signing because I want the freedom to choose what is best for my children without the government having control over that decision.
nodes.author: Mary Coyne
nodes.extracted: I’m signing because I want the freedom to choose what is best for my children without the government having control over that decision.

nodes.comment: End mandates and bring back freedom to choose. As parents it is our right to say yes or no to masks and it is beyond time for our local representatives to listen to our voices.
nodes.author: Shawn Coyne
nodes.extracted: End mandates and bring back freedom to choose.

nodes.comment: Life, LIBERTY, and pursuit of happiness… We should have the FREEDOM of choice!
nodes.author: Lydia Capela
nodes.extracted: Life, LIBERTY, and pursuit of happiness… We should have the FREEDOM of choice!

nodes.comment: Simple answer…CHOICE!  Parents/families should be able to have the freedom to make the choice for their children on this matter, not the school board.  Information is only as good as its source…would be happy to supply the board with mounds of studies/science to prove the ill-effects of wearing masks, especially by children.
nodes.author: Dale Capela
nodes.extracted: Parents/families should be able to have the freedom to make the choice for their children on this matter, not the school board.

nodes.comment: I believe in individual freedom. This is America
nodes.author: Jennifer Harris
nodes.extracted: I believe in individual freedom.

nodes.comment: I love this! We must stand up against these outrageous mandates. It’s time for freedom to rule!
nodes.author: Austin Schuster
nodes.extracted: It’s time for freedom to rule!

nodes.comment: It’s our choice. Freedom to choose
nodes.author: Angela NOSWORTHY
nodes.extracted: Freedom to choose

nodes.comment: I believe in freedom to make your own decisions for your own children.
nodes.author: Angelia Reid
nodes.extracted: I believe in freedom to make your own decisions for your own children.

nodes.comment: I believe in our freedom to do our own benefit/risk analysis.
nodes.author: Rhiannon Mindas
nodes.extracted: I believe in our freedom to do our own benefit/risk analysis.

nodes.comment: This is very upsetting that the people who are supposed to be looking out for our kids are using them as pawns. Our children need social development, they need to see faces and have relationships, they need their voices heard. They need to be taken seriously when they say they can’t breathe or their mental health is being affected. If people want to wear a mask, please do. If they want to do virtual, please do. Please let our kids have the same freedom. They matter!
nodes.author: Angela Brown
nodes.extracted: Please let our kids have the same freedom.

nodes.comment: I am signing because this is a direct attack against our medical freedom against something that has no scientific data to back it up.
nodes.author: Tracy Abbott
nodes.extracted: I am signing because this is a direct attack against our medical freedom against something that has no scientific data to back it up.

nodes.comment: I’ signing because the freedom of choice is a liberty that we cannot allow to be tainted or taken for any reason. It is our right as Americans and we must continue to enforce it!
nodes.author: Jessica Ringle
nodes.extracted: I’ signing because the freedom of choice is a liberty that we cannot allow to be tainted or taken for any reason.

nodes.comment: I don’t think our freedom of choice should be taken from us. We should have the option to send our kids with our without masks and not be told they are mandated.
nodes.author: Cara Nackers
nodes.extracted: I don’t think our freedom of choice should be taken from us.

nodes.comment: These children do not need to be muzzled anymore. The masks are dirty and make it harder for them to breath. Not to mention the dirt and bacteria in them. And nobody's wears them properly anyways so why bother. Give the parents the freedom to make their own choice. Enough is enough!

nodes.extracted: Give the parents the freedom to make their own choice.

nodes.comment: Parents choice and to keep our freedom.

nodes.comment: I stand for medical freedom!

nodes.comment: Because our rights and freedoms are promised us by the constitution and bible, and supported by the many who have died and fought for said freedom!

nodes.extracted: Because our rights and freedoms are promised us by the constitution and bible, and supported by the many who have died and fought for said freedom!

nodes.comment: Covid has been politicized and because of that mandates cannot be established as that would make it authoritarian.  When an issue is politicized the people must vote on the matter that is what makes the difference between freedom and authoritarian mandates.

nodes.comment: Freedom of choice!!
nodes.author: Maurice Albrecht

nodes.comment: My son's freedom of choice.

nodes.comment:
College is far removed from from a place of intellectual reativity, personal freedom and higher learning. States like ND are Conservative in nature but just like everywhere else, marxists at the college "leadership" level are destroying it per the communist manifesto they all subscribe to with their anti American masters.  Confront school leadership at the grocery store, on the sidewalk, anywhere they choose to go - berate them and call them communists to their faces.  End their reign of uninformed medical terrorism by destroying their self confidence and attitudes.  Like the  union school teachers rubber stamping communist school boards and administration agendas with young children, college leadership needs to be dealt with as well.  No masks, protect our children or change schools.   

China is smiling right now.
nodes.author: Charlie Schmidt
nodes.extracted: College is far removed from from a place of intellectual reativity, personal freedom and higher learning.

nodes.comment:
M-mental (& physical)
A-abuse to
S-school
K-kids
They should not be forced to wear masks, be tested, or to be vaccinated!!
(I grew up in Jeffco, raised our kids in Jeffco, & was an educator for 25.5 years in Jeffco. I'm now standing up for freedom in Jeffco!)
nodes.author: Karen King
nodes.extracted: I'm now standing up for freedom in Jeffco!)

nodes.comment: Freedom!

We all deserve freedom of choice!!!!
If parents can choose to send their kids to school with masks, I can choose to send mine without!

nodes.comment: I want to be able to keep freedom of choice in our schools regarding masks. I don’t want FMSD to spend time and money on a legal battle against the state when they could spend that focusing on the education of our children.
nodes.author: Rebecca Hershberger
nodes.extracted: I want to be able to keep freedom of choice in our schools regarding masks.

nodes.comment: Freedom of choice!
nodes.author: hanna Oconnor
nodes.extracted: Freedom of choice!

nodes.comment: I believe in freedom for parents to decide what is best for their children.

nodes.extracted: To save our Health Freedom and to stop anyone, but a parent, to make ANY sort of Heath decisions for a child!

nodes.comment: Freedom of choice!!!!  No one should be forced to do something against their will.  Wear a mask if you choose, not because you are forced.
nodes.author: Amy Fincher
nodes.extracted: Freedom of choice!!!!

nodes.comment: I believe in parental choice and freedom
nodes.author: Jackie Bayne
nodes.extracted: I believe in parental choice and freedom

nodes.comment: I will not sign this. It is a choice to wear a mask or not. Stop judging others choices. #stopmaskshaming. If you are too afraid stay home in your bubble and cower. Stop trying to control other people's freedom to live their lives as they see fit. Shame on this country, we are raising cry babies and scaredy cats. What are you going to do when flu season starts like it does ever year? Spoiler alert you might not want to leave your house ever. Your immune system is so low right now from listening to these so called "experts and metrics" you might not be sbke to survive the common cold. Be careful how you follow the flock and remember you are pleading and begging for it. There will always be Amazon and curbside pick up. Stop ruining it for everyone else.
nodes.author: Heather Smith
nodes.extracted: Stop trying to control other people's freedom to live their lives as they see fit.

nodes.comment:
When it comes to the health and safety of our children we should all be members of the “Common Sense Party,” and put trust in the CDC and acclaimed medical and scientific experts, as well as our friends and heroes working in the hospitals who tell us they are overwhelmed with new cases of the unvaccinated.  We all love our children an shouldn’t take risks with their health and safety.  Under 12 year olds aren’t vaccinated.  Don’t wait until you are crying while a loved one is on a ventilator before you decide to protect them. Unvaccinated people who don’t wear masks think they should be able to play Russian Roulette with the Delta Variant in the chamber and aimed at our children in the name of their personal freedom.
Hell No!

Masks for teachers and children must be mandated!

Sent from my iPhone
nodes.author: Gary Jodat
nodes.extracted: Unvaccinated people who don’t wear masks think they should be able to play Russian Roulette with the Delta Variant in the chamber and aimed at our children in the name of their personal freedom.

nodes.comment: I am a public health professional with colleagues in some of the hardest-hit states. Children are at Great risk from this virus. And wearing a mask is not an obstruction of personal freedom, it is common sense public health for the greater good.
nodes.author: Mary Herbert
nodes.extracted: And wearing a mask is not an obstruction of personal freedom, it is common sense public health for the greater good.

nodes.comment: Data. Freedom.
nodes.author: sonya waters
nodes.extracted: Freedom.

nodes.comment: I’m signing this petition because I am angry that my OC Board of Supervisors made such a reckless decision when they caved to some loud, ill-informed people who value their own comfort above the health and safety of the public, and changed their guidelines on mask-wearing to “recommended”. This sent the message to people that NOT wearing a mask is perhaps not recommended, but it will not be enforced or even expected. I resent that MY freedom to SAFELY go out has been restricted.
nodes.author: Martha Key
nodes.extracted: I resent that MY freedom to SAFELY go out has been restricted.

nodes.comment: I want my kids to have the freedom of not masking!!
nodes.author: Krystin Shray
nodes.extracted: I want my kids to have the freedom of not masking!

nodes.comment: I’m signing because I’m a man and men are supposed to be protectors. If you equate “freedom” with running around maskless during a pandemic please crack a book and read up on pandemics.
nodes.author: Christopher Dale
nodes.extracted: If you equate “freedom” with running around maskless during a pandemic please crack a book and read up on pandemics.

nodes.comment: It’s time to be done with masks- we are a country of freedom and should be allowed to choose whether we want to wear them - not forced to do so.
nodes.author: Harrison Mitton
nodes.extracted: It’s time to be done with masks- we are a country of freedom and should be allowed to choose whether we want to wear them - not forced to do so.

nodes.comment: Freedom in medical choices
nodes.author: Jennifer Hamilton
nodes.extracted: Freedom in medical choices

nodes.comment: Can’t believe we’re putting “personal freedom “ before people’s health and lives ! We need to protect not only each-other but our families too ! Bring the mask mandate back, many people are not doing their part !!
nodes.author: Michelle Fernandez
nodes.extracted: Can’t believe we’re putting “personal freedom “ before people’s health and lives !

nodes.comment: It astonishes me that we can’t put aside politics to protect our children and each other.  My hospital is full, the ICU is full, the patients are younger and the speed at which this wave hit us is truly scary. And all preventable. If you choose not to wear a mask or vaccinate yourself you are not displaying freedom, you are just selfish. But I guess that is your right.  Kids (especially under 12) don’t get that choice. Let’s protect them. That should be something we can agree on.
nodes.author: Kyle Stephens
nodes.extracted: If you choose not to wear a mask or vaccinate yourself you are not displaying freedom, you are just selfish.

nodes.comment: I believe in medical freedom!
nodes.author: Kim Johnson
nodes.extracted: I believe in medical freedom!

nodes.comment: This isn't about freedom. It's not about control. It's not about baselessly forcing people to do something they may disagree with. This is about following the science, looking at the data, and listening to public health experts who believe that we need to make mitigating efforts to slow the spread of the virus until more people are able to be vaccinated or until the virus subsides. If parents have children who have a medical or developmental condition which might prohibit them from being able to wear a mask, there are and can be exceptions for those students -- however those students are one of the primary reasons all or most children (and teachers and staff) in schools should be wearing masks: to protect others. Even after their emergency meeting and after receiving a petition with ~700 signatures, it seems as though the Haywood County School Board still does not want to protect others, let alone their own community.
nodes.author: Cody Jones
nodes.extracted: This isn't about freedom.

nodes.comment: Masks won’t work unless everyone is masked. And it’s not a risk we should take. These are children’s lives, we should do everything we can to protect it and their freedom, masks are the answer.
nodes.author: Alix Scoffil
nodes.extracted: These are children’s lives, we should do everything we can to protect it and their freedom, masks are the answer.

nodes.comment: This is infringing on our personal freedoms and putting our kids at long term health risks!!! Enough is enough! It is time to take our freedom back!!
nodes.author: Ashley Serra
nodes.extracted: It is time to take our freedom back!

nodes.comment: Wearing masks actually gives us more freedom, by allowing us to stay healthy and go back to work sooner than if we don’t mandate masks.
nodes.author: Rachel Beltran
nodes.extracted: Wearing masks actually gives us more freedom, by allowing us to stay healthy and go back to work sooner than if we don’t mandate masks.

nodes.comment:
If "Not being required to wear a mask in public" is "freedom", why not, then, demand the freedom to drive without seat-belts? Without eyeglasses? Drunk! To go boating without a life-jacket!
Oh! And to be belligerent about it too! "Nobody's going to make me put on that stupid seat-belt/mask/Life-jacket"! (But you expect someone to come to the rescue when you're thrown through the windshield or overboard? And to tend you in the Covid ward? To say nothing of the other people you've infected or crashed into?
Yeesh! How stupid can some people be?
nodes.author: David Paktor
nodes.extracted: If "Not being required to wear a mask in public" is "freedom", why not, then, demand the freedom to drive without seat-belts?

nodes.comment: I am in healthcare and grew up in OC where my mom lives. I don’t want my mom, brother or step father dying because of a desire for “freedom”. Mask it for casket.
nodes.author: Kelly Hughes
nodes.extracted: I don’t want my mom, brother or step father dying because of a desire for “freedom”.

nodes.comment: Because I believe there are more citizens who are willing to protect others and themselves by wearing a mask than people who selfishly refuse to put one on and misuse it as a symbol of freedom. The Board of Supervisors acted defensively  and dangerously by allowing themselves to be bullied by the misguided.
nodes.author: Sheryl Farber
nodes.extracted: Because I believe there are more citizens who are willing to protect others and themselves by wearing a mask than people who selfishly refuse to put one on and misuse it as a symbol of freedom.

nodes.comment: The only reason I'm signing this is to be able to point out that while often times wearing a mask can improve the situation, you don't have the right to force everyone else to bend to your will. If you want the freedom to not have a mask stripped off of your face, you must respect everyone else's freedom to not force a mask onto theirs. This is the basic golden rule everyone should have learned by now. I have a very weak immune system and am at great risk for dying from coronavirus but, I have taken every precaution I can, and remained mindful of ways I can avoid contracting it, and I have forged a path that I have been able to, so far, NOT contract the disease as my test showed. If you take some personal accountability and put effort into keeping yourself safe, you can avoid being infected by this dangerous disease AND not step on everyone else's toes which will ultimately be the unity we need to beat this!!
nodes.author: Scrappyy Matty
nodes.extracted: If you want the freedom to not have a mask stripped off of your face, you must respect everyone else's freedom to not force a mask onto theirs.

nodes.comment:
We're the UNITED States of America. If the South is fucked then we're all fucked.

I get not wanting laws telling you to cover your face, especially in the summer heat.

But masks only really work if everyone's wearing them. They give us the freedom to open up businesses without fearing COVID. And unfortunately a bunch of people won't believe in COVID until they personally get it or know someone who does, and we as a nation don't have the time for all these people to learn that COVID isn't a hoax through experience (not to mention how many people would have to die before this lesson gets through to everyone).

Please make masks mandatory!
nodes.author: Steven Barnes
nodes.extracted: They give us the freedom to open up businesses without fearing COVID.

nodes.comment: I believe each individual should have the freedom to choose whether they wear a mask or not.
nodes.author: Tamara Orlando
nodes.extracted: I believe each individual should have the freedom to choose whether they wear a mask or not.

nodes.comment: The politicization around masking  is ludicrous political theatre around a false narrative of “freedom”. Freedom to endanger others-families, children and damage to their economic well-being that can result of illness is not a right.
nodes.author: Jennifer Stevens
nodes.extracted: The politicization around masking  is ludicrous political theatre around a false narrative of “freedom”. [...] Freedom to endanger others-families, children and damage to their economic well-being that can result of illness is not a right.

nodes.comment: We have freedom of speech, but that doesn’t mean we get to endanger people with words like “fire!” in a crowded space. We have the freedom of expression to decide what kind of clothes we want to wear. We should not have the freedom to endanger people by not wearing a simple mask.  Masks are our best strategy to slow the spread of COVID-19. I understand the need to open businesses and schools, even though I may disagree. But dropping the mask mandate is beyond reckless. It is negligent homicide.
nodes.author: Kathryn Rosenmann
nodes.extracted: We have freedom of speech, but that doesn’t mean we get to endanger people with words like “fire!” in a crowded space. [...] We have the freedom of expression to decide what kind of clothes we want to wear. [...] We should not have the freedom to endanger people by not wearing a simple mask.

nodes.comment: The people have had their chance to exercise their freedom and take responsibility for stopping the spread by getting vaccinated and wearing masks, but unfortunately, the majority of people in our community aren’t taking responsibility, and instead it seems that this as an opportunity to flaunt your “freedom” by completely disregarding proven mitigation measures (universal mask wearing in K-12 schools). Our hospitals are full and our PICUs are getting full. Why are we letting this virus spread like wildfire through such a vulnerable population, our children who can’t be vaccinated, when it is clear that the mask mandate worked to decrease the spread last school year? Why are we not looking at the other states that have already started school and are seeing skyrocketing cases in children, and acting before this gets out of hand here? We have already brought travel nurses to our hospitals before the school year began. What happens when we run out of resources again after the predicted surge we’re bound to see now that school has started? How many children have to get sick, be hospitalized, or worse, for this to be taken seriously so we don’t have to put our children in harm’s way?
nodes.author: Sarah Bolla
nodes.extracted: The people have had their chance to exercise their freedom and take responsibility for stopping the spread by getting vaccinated and wearing masks, but unfortunately, the majority of people in our community aren’t taking responsibility, and instead it seems that this as an opportunity to flaunt your “freedom” by completely disregarding proven mitigation measures (universal mask wearing in K-12 schools).

nodes.comment: It should be freedom to choose not mandated and not with a fine
nodes.author: D'Ann DaBell
nodes.extracted: It should be freedom to choose not mandated and not with a fine

nodes.comment: Because I want to protect myself and the lives of those in my family as well as others.  Not selfish or losing freedom. It’s about respect and the truth about how COVID spreads.
nodes.author: Gigi Molina
nodes.extracted: Not selfish or losing freedom.

nodes.comment: I will fight for freedom
nodes.author: Aliyah Brown
nodes.extracted: I will fight for freedom

nodes.comment: If you’re concerned about your personal freedoms, then please consider wearing a mask as YOUR freedom to protect your neighbor. It’s a very small thing you can do that will make a huge difference. Let’s keep our economy open. WEAR A MASK.
nodes.author: Davis Knight
nodes.extracted: If you’re concerned about your personal freedoms, then please consider wearing a mask as YOUR freedom to protect your neighbor.

nodes.comment: I am signing this because wearing a mask for an extended time is unhealthy to continually breathe one's own air leaving them trapped to not breath fresh air! I am signing this because it is demeaning and loses one's character and freedom of choice. I am signing this because I believe there is no pandemic!
nodes.author: Joelene DeFranco
nodes.extracted: I am signing this because it is demeaning and loses one's character and freedom of choice.

nodes.comment: Protect our kids! Mask is not about religion, not about freedom, but about the respect to the life!
nodes.author: Sharon Hu
nodes.extracted: Mask is not about religion, not about freedom, but about the respect to the life!

nodes.comment: I like Freedom and Air!
nodes.author: Michelle Cherry
nodes.extracted: I like Freedom and Air!

nodes.comment: The health and safety of students, teachers and staff are far more important than DeSantis’  political posturing and misinformed and irresponsible parents’ demands . Personal freedom ends when it threatens public safety.
nodes.author: Kathleen Keohane
nodes.extracted: Personal freedom ends when it threatens public safety.

nodes.comment: Medical freedom to choose matters!
nodes.author: Eliza Dickenson
nodes.extracted: Medical freedom to choose matters!

nodes.comment: I love my kid and the amazing faculty and staff at the school who are shackled by this horrible governor's lack of leadership. This is not a matter of freedom it is public safety and child welfare. To look at it as anything else is ridiculous.
nodes.author: Marissa Segundo
nodes.extracted: This is not a matter of freedom it is public safety and child welfare.

nodes.comment: As parents we should have the freedom to chose what is best for our children.
nodes.author: Katie Troyer
nodes.extracted: As parents we should have the freedom to chose what is best for our children.

nodes.comment: First Amendment Right! Freedom of choice.! This is a free country! This is why people want to live here. I am thankful for that right and intend to use it as a proud acting American citizen.
nodes.author: Catherine Pfeffer
nodes.extracted: Freedom of choice.!

nodes.comment: A face diaper will not protect you that is right from the CDC, mandates are illegal and violates your freedom.
nodes.author: Richard Evey
nodes.extracted: A face diaper will not protect you that is right from the CDC, mandates are illegal and violates your freedom.

nodes.comment: I am signing because...freedom!
nodes.author: Cynthia Howell
nodes.extracted: I am signing because...freedom!

nodes.comment: I am immune compromised and over 65 ,and don’t want to get thee virus on someone’s selfish idea of freedom
nodes.author: radhika schwartz
nodes.extracted: I am immune compromised and over 65 ,and don’t want to get thee virus on someone’s selfish idea of freedom

nodes.comment: It’s a no brainer. Our “it’s a free country” attitude, doesn’t give people the right to endanger other people’s lives. As a lawyer said to me, your constitutional right to your first amendment freedom, ends at the end of your fist where it meets my nose.
nodes.author: Elizabeth Komins
nodes.extracted: As a lawyer said to me, your constitutional right to your first amendment freedom, ends at the end of your fist where it meets my nose.

nodes.comment: Masks are proven to harmful both physically and psychologically. I children need to be able to breathe freely, especially during this crucial time in their growth and development. It is also important for them to be able to interact and see others facial hair expressions. The science doesn’t warrant masks and freedom to choose is a God given right in this country. End it now!
nodes.author: Kelly Jacobo
nodes.extracted: The science doesn’t warrant masks and freedom to choose is a God given right in this country.

nodes.comment: Freedom of choice. Protect our constitutional rights!

nodes.comment: Masks are not about your feelings, or your freedom.  They are about protecting your fellow citizens. Do. Your. Part.

nodes.comment: I believe in freedom of choice and parents decide what's right for their kids!

nodes.comment: This is the right thing to do. I am a physician, I follow evidence and we need to protect each other. There is no freedom, no economy if people are dead and we will be responsible for that!!!!!
nodes.author: fariha shafi
nodes.extracted: There is no freedom, no economy if people are dead and we will be responsible for that!!!!

nodes.comment:
Over twenty years of teaching, students and peers have been lost to illness and accident. Each time painful, but never from something I should/could have helped prevent. 

“Freedom makes a huge requirement of every human being. With freedom comes responsibility. For the person who is unwilling to grow up, the person who does not want to carry his own weight, this is a frightening prospect.” ― Eleanor Roosevelt, You Learn by Living: Eleven Keys for a More Fulfilling Life

“Freedom is the will to be responsible for ourselves.” ― Friedrich Nietzsche, Twilight of the Idols

“Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.” ― Aldous Huxley, Complete Essays 2, 1926-29

“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” ― Mark Twain
nodes.author: Neva Wuerfel
nodes.extracted:
“Freedom makes a huge requirement of every human being. [...] With freedom comes responsibility. [...] For the person who is unwilling to grow up, the person who does not want to carry his own weight, this is a frightening prospect.” ― Eleanor Roosevelt, You Learn by Living: Eleven Keys for a More Fulfilling Life

“Freedom is the will to be responsible for ourselves.” ― Friedrich Nietzsche, Twilight of the Idols

“Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.” ― Aldous Huxley, Complete Essays 2, 1926-29

“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” ― Mark Twain

nodes.comment: Freedom is what America should be based on!

nodes.comment: Masks/Vaccines should be optional. Personal choice & freedom to choose what is right for you
nodes.author: Cathleen Hoffman-Brunne
nodes.extracted: Personal choice & freedom to choose what is right for you

nodes.comment: Keep our freedom of choice!
nodes.author: Samantha Tate
nodes.extracted: Keep our freedom of choice!

nodes.comment: I believe in the freedom of individuals to choose whether to wear a mask or not. I am a Wisconsin resident and would like to be able to visit Pierce county without being forced to wear face mask. I also do not believe the Health Dept. Which is non elected persons should be making decisions about an entire community and their personal health.
nodes.author: Kim Landry-Ayres
nodes.extracted: I believe in the freedom of individuals to choose whether to wear a mask or not.

nodes.comment: I believe in freedom. I believe in Liberty. I believe in free will. And Gigi ping is not my God or my leader and these authoritarians need to really take a good hard look at themselves. ✊ Rise up and God bless the USA
nodes.author: David Robbins
nodes.extracted: I believe in freedom.

nodes.comment: Freedom. The constitution. My children’s health.
nodes.author: Kelly Koenig
nodes.extracted: Freedom.

nodes.comment: They know kids are safe from it they want to raise our kids to sit down shut up and comply. nodes.comment: I’m signing because this is AMERICA, and we deserve our freedom to choose!
nodes.author: Amity Rice

nodes.comment: Our children need to breathe and be kids. This is crossing the line unmask our children ! Freedom

nodes.extracted: Freedom

nodes.comment: We deserve the freedom to choose what we put in our bodies, especially when it comes to an experimental shot in which we have no clue as to the long term side effects.
nodes.author: Cristina Chavez
nodes.extracted: We deserve the freedom to choose what we put in our bodies, especially when it comes to an experimental shot in which we have no clue as to the long term side effects.

nodes.comment: Because I can understand the difference in "a minor inconvenience that literally saves human lives" and "taking away my freedom."
nodes.author: Jordan French
nodes.extracted: Because I can understand the difference in "a minor inconvenience that literally saves human lives" and "taking away my freedom."

nodes.comment: I can make decisions about my families health risks without help from the school district. Freedom to wear a mask or not wear one lies with the individual and their family.
nodes.author: Tameron Coslin
nodes.extracted: Freedom to wear a mask or not wear one lies with the individual and their family.

nodes.comment: Freedom
nodes.author: Samantha Checketts
nodes.extracted: Freedom

nodes.comment: You can not have Freedom without Responsibility

nodes.comment: My 3 grandchildren spent the all of last year’s completely masked! This is an outrage on many levels! It makes it very hard to breatheAnd it is not good for their mental health exclamation this is a political issue not a health issue. We need to stop listening to the people who are trying to scare our children and scare us! Let the children have freedom to breathe and freedom to learn!
nodes.author: Robin Harria
nodes.extracted: Let the children have freedom to breathe and freedom to learn!

nodes.comment: I’m signing because I care about our students, their education, and the overall wellbeing of our community. A small act that carries a big impact in caring for one another should not be so controversial. One person’s ‘freedom’ does not negate another’s right to quality of life … masking is simply the right thing to do.
nodes.author: Kelly Knapp
nodes.extracted: One person’s ‘freedom’ does not negate another’s right to quality of life … masking is simply the right thing to do.

nodes.comment: I do not support mask mandates.  I support parents choice. Freedom to choose.
nodes.author: Mary Foley
nodes.extracted: Freedom to choose.

nodes.comment: Kids safety and life should be most important agenda compare to expressions of freedom and mental health. 1000 of kids have died across glob with delta variant and we should not take it casually and push political agenda. Please think how will you fell if GOD forbid if you lose your kids.
nodes.author: Nazir Siddiqi
nodes.extracted: Kids safety and life should be most important agenda compare to expressions of freedom and mental health.

nodes.comment: I'm a concerned grandparent. I'm all about freedom, but I'm all for common sense as well.
nodes.author: Gustavo Contreras
nodes.extracted: I'm all about freedom, but I'm all for common sense as well.

nodes.comment: It is vital to do everything possible to keep children in school.  Since vaccination of younger students is still not possible, and the vaccines are not 100% protection for older students, masks are the next best step to try to keep schools open.  Individual freedom is a poor excuse to prevent the protocols necessary to stop a pandemic that can so easily kill and damage human lives.
nodes.author: Melvin Knuth
nodes.extracted: Individual freedom is a poor excuse to prevent the protocols necessary to stop a pandemic that can so easily kill and damage human lives.

nodes.comment:
I am signing this petition as a mom and a pediatric healthcare worker. We need our local school districts to have the freedom to protect the children we entrust them to educate. 

Hospitals also need the flexibility to provide care that declaring a State of Emergency would provide, but that Gov. Stitt is politically motivated not to establish due to his stance on masking.
nodes.author: Brandi Belicek
nodes.extracted: We need our local school districts to have the freedom to protect the children we entrust them to educate.
